items.title: Subway Rider Choked Homeless Man to Death, Medical Examiner Rules
items.abstract: Jordan Neely died after a man held him in a chokehold. On Wednesday, the medical examiner’s office said the cause of death was compression of the neck, and ruled it a homicide.

items.title: How Manhattan Hotels Became Refuges for Thousands of Migrants
items.abstract: The city has spent millions to convert upscale hotels, humble motels and even office buildings into housing for an influx of migrants.

items.title: Invincible Looks on City Streets
items.abstract: From 1980 to 1990, Amy Arbus roamed the streets taking pictures for The Village Voice of “anybody that turns your head.” Her photographs, now on exhibit in NoHo, range from everyday people to celebrities like the Clash.

items.title: Finding Their Gym on the City’s Streets
items.abstract: A workout group known as the Rise blends an enthusiasm for rigorous fitness with an ethos of camaraderie.

items.title: One Cure for Pandemic Doldrums: Walking Every Street in Your City
items.abstract: In Peoria, Ill., and elsewhere, pedestrians said their quests brought a sense of purpose and helped them appreciate long-overlooked hometown sights.
